subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] FW: Re: Guess they want it shared!
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
Yep, that's pretty much what the originator of the idea came up with, but we 
need to slow down just alittle to have time to get all the stuff together, 
like a good sounding, reilaible Ghost box, a server, and a provider.


>From: "Travis" <vampire2kd@...>
>Reply-To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
>To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [EVP-ITC] FW: Re: Guess they want it shared!
>Date: Fri, 03 Aug 2007 11:53:28 -0000
>
>Well there is audio streaming software out there, for instance the
>software that is used to set up an internet radio stream. I had my
>own station set up (just for me though) to stream to the virtual
>world of Second Life. That way instead of listening to just any
>stream I had a set up so I could listen to the music off another one
>of my boxes and have it streamed directly into Second Life. This is
>completely different though but if you have another box you can use
>as a server you could set up (or possibly someone else) a internet
>radio stream, to connect we would use your ip and possibly use
>something like winamp to connect to the stream. It will most likely
>come out a bit laggy but if you have decent cable connection and you
>are only using it for a timed session obviously it wouldnt be that
>bad.I guess it all depends.
>   Now if you are talking streaming 24/7 then its a whole different
>thing. Regards,
>               T.L.
>--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Frank Sumption" <franks-boxes@...>
>wrote:
> >
> > Yeah, but I think bandwidth will be a problem. I'm far behind on
>the
> > software end of it, but hopefully someone out there has some ideas.
> > Supplying the box is the easy part!
> >
> > Frank
> >
> >
> > >From: "psi_research" <vilhellm@...>
> > >Reply-To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> > >To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> > >Subject: [EVP-ITC] FW: Re: Guess they want it shared!
> > >Date: Thu, 02 Aug 2007 22:13:01 -0000
> > >
> > >I like the idea a lot. Its easy to wonder about possible
>interaction
> > >with the Box from anywhere. Different people receiving personal
> > >messages simultaneously is something I've already observed in
>sessions
> > >where you have multiple people present. It will be interesting to
>run
> > >a box session on the network for a specified time and have
>listeners
> > >post the messages they heard on the forum so results can be
>compared.
> > >
> > >-Bill
> > >
> > >--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "bhali333"
> > ><paranormalinvestigating@> wrote:
> > > >
> > > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Frank Sumption" <franks-boxes@>
> > > > wrote:
> > > > >
> > > > >  Piece of cake! The boxes are pretty much ready, it requires
>only
> > > > > connecting the box line out to the sound card input, and
>sending
> > > > out
> > > > > over the internet, which I have no idea how to do the soft
>ware
> > > > > part, but the guy that suggested seems to.
> > > > >
> > > > >  I'm sure that people in different locations would get
>different
> > > > > messages although, presumalby, the box was outputing only a
>single
> > > > > stream of information.
> > > > >
> > > > >  This is something to be excited about. It could be just
>weeks away.
> > > > >
> > > > >
> > > > >  Frank-S
> > > > >
> > > > >
> > > > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Travis" <vampire2kd@> wrote:
> > > > > >
> > > > > > Thats an awesome idea. imagine though its streaming live
>across
> > > > > cables
> > > > > > throughout the states. The possibility of the audio being
>further
> > > > > > influenced is greater Im sure. Reminds me of when a radio
>show was
> > > > > > being done on evps people recording the show played it back
>later
> > > > > to
> > > > > > listen again and heard messages to them during the play
>back and
> > > > > this
> > > > > > was being reported from tons of people. So its pretty
>interesting
> > > > > if
> > > > > > you can actually have this done, cant wait to see what
>happens.
> > > > > >
> > > > > >
> > > > > >
> > > > > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Frank Sumption" <franks-
>boxes@>
> > > > > wrote:
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > It's like DAH!!! Why I not think about this!? Setup an
>internet
> > > > > server
> > > > > > > (somehow) and connect a box to the internet to run 24/7---
>-
> > > > LIVE.
> > > > > Or
> > > > > > make
> > > > > > > coordinated short tests so remote reception can be
>compared to
> > > > > > local. It
> > > > > > > would be an easy task to make modes and bands switchable
> > > > > remotely as
> > > > > > well.
> > > > > > > What about multiple boxes?
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > Just imagine, a box accessible to the world 24 hours a
>day,
> > > > seven
> > > > > > days a
> > > > > > > week! It staggers the imagination! Given the nature of the
> > > > > voices and
> > > > > > > contacts, I wouldn't be surprised if several people could
> > > > access
> > > > > the
> > > > > > system
> > > > > > > at the exact same time, yet all receive personal
>communications.
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > Guess that would create wee ripple in the darkside!!
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > I wasn't sure if the originator of the idea wanted his
>name out
> > > > > > there, I
> > > > > > > took it off.
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > Frank-S
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > >To: "Frank Sumption" <franks-boxes@>
> > > > > > > >Subject: Re: Guess they want it shared!
> > > > > > > >Date: Thu, 02 Aug 2007 05:56:16 -0000
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > >--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Frank Sumption" <franks-
> > > > > boxes@> wrote:
> > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > There's no way I can stop making boxes, I just don't
>have
> > > > the
> > > > > > > >resuources to
> > > > > > > > > supply them to everyone that wants at this time, plus
> > > > trying
> > > > > ot find
> > > > > > > >waay to
> > > > > > > > > make the things more better. I am no engineer, and it
>takes
> > > > a
> > > > > > while to
> > > > > > > > > figure things out--as with all aspects of this life.
> > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > Frank-S
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > >Hey Frank,
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > >Its me again
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > >I haven't had much time to work on ITC lately but I'm
> > > > > interested in
> > > > > > > >taking a slightly different approach using a quantum
>random
> > > > > number
> > > > > > > >generator (unless its cost prohibitive) and computer
>(hoping it
> > > > > > > >doesn't get fried).
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > >But... what are your thoughts on this:
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > >What if we hooked up one of your boxes to the internet
>for
> > > > > remote
> > > > > > > >users to attempt interaction with?  Leaning on the non-
> > > > locality
> > > > > theory.
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > >Couple things I'm wondering about, assuming it works:
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > >- Would the box work "better" physically present at
>a "high
> > > > > energy"
> > > > > > > >location?  I'm refering to locations on Earth that are
>known
> > > > to
> > > > > be
> > > > > > > >high energy from lay lines, etc. "portals".
> > > > > > > >- Will the recorded audio from your box be the same
>recorded
> > > > or
> > > > > heard
> > > > > > > >audio at the remote location?  Meaning will the EVP be
> > > > > recordable at
> > > > > > > >your location or only the remote users location?  Or if
>both,
> > > > > will
> > > > > > > >they match?
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > >Just some things I've been thinking about lately.
>Curious
> > > > what
> > > > > you
> > > > > > think.
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > >Thanks,
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > >
> > > >
